ARTVTHCV.name: Antiretroviral therapy coverage, total
ARTVTHCV.definition: Antiretroviral therapy coverage indicates the percentage of adults and children with advanced HIV infection currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among the estimated number of people needing antiretroviral therapy based on WHO 2010 guidelines.

ARTVTHFE.name: Antiretroviral therapy coverage, female
ARTVTHFE.source: UN Inter-Agency and Expert Group on Gender Statistics (IAEG-GS)
ARTVTHFE.definition: Antiretroviral therapy coverage indicates the percentage of adults and children with advanced HIV infection currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among the estimated number of people needing antiretroviral therapy based on WHO 2010 guidelines.

ARTVTHMA.name: Antiretroviral therapy coverage, male
ARTVTHMA.source: UN Inter-Agency and Expert Group on Gender Statistics (IAEG-GS)
ARTVTHMA.definition: Antiretroviral therapy coverage indicates the percentage of adults and children with advanced HIV infection currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among the estimated number of people needing antiretroviral therapy based on WHO 2010 guidelines.

HIVSFEIN.name: Female share of people living with HIV
HIVSFEIN.definition: The percentage of the HIV female population aged 15-49 of the total HIV population in the same age group.

HIVYFEIN.name: HIV prevalence among youth (15-24), female
HIVYFEIN.definition: The prevalence of HIV among the population 15–24 years of age is the number of individuals aged 15–24 living with HIV expressed as a percentage of the total population aged 15-24.

HIVYMAIN.name: HIV prevalence among youth (15-24), male
HIVYMAIN.definition: The prevalence of HIV among the population 15–24 years of age is the number of individuals aged 15–24 living with HIV expressed as a percentage of the total population aged 15-24.

HIVNFEIN.name: People living with HIV (15+), female
HIVNFEIN.definition: Number of women living with HIV (15+)

HIVNTOIN.name: People living with HIV (15+), total
HIVNTOIN.definition: Total number of people living with HIV, (15+)

INMORATO.name: Infant mortality rate, total
INMORATO.source: Compiled by World Bank, Estimates developed by the UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UNICEF, WHO, World Bank, UN DESA Population Division) at www.childmortality.org.
INMORATO.definition: Number of deaths under one year of age occurring among the live births in a given geographical area during a given year, per 1,000 live births occurring among the population of the given geographical area during the same year.

IGMEFEIN.name: Infant mortality rate, female
IGMEFEIN.source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (IGME)
IGMEFEIN.definition: Number of deaths under one year of age occurring among the live births in a given geographical area during a given year, per 1,000 live births occurring among the population of the given geographical area during the same year.

IGMEMAIN.name: Infant mortality rate, male
IGMEMAIN.source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (IGME)
IGMEMAIN.definition: Number of deaths under one year of age occurring among the live births in a given geographical area during a given year, per 1,000 live births occurring among the population of the given geographical area during the same year.

NEMORATO.name: Neonatal mortality rate, total
NEMORATO.source: Compiled by World Bank, Estimates developed by the UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UNICEF, WHO, World Bank, UN DESA Population Division) at www.childmortality.org.
NEMORATO.definition: Neonatal mortality rate is the number of neonates dying before reaching 28 days of age, per 1,000 live births in a given year.

MALHFEIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, height for age, stunting, female
MALHFEIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
MALHFEIN.definition: Prevalence of child malnutrition is the percentage of children under age 5 whose height for age (stunting) is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months. For children up to two years old height is measured by recumbent length. For older children height is measured by stature while standing. The data are based on the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.

MALHMAIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, height for age, stunting, male
MALHMAIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
MALHMAIN.definition: Prevalence of child malnutrition is the percentage of children under age 5 whose height for age (stunting) is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59 months. For children up to two years old height is measured by recumbent length. For older children height is measured by stature while standing. The data are based on the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.

OWC5FEIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, weight for age, overweight, female
OWC5FEIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
OWC5FEIN.definition: Prevalence of overweight children is the percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations above the median for the international reference population of the corresponding age as established by the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.

OWC5MAIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, weight for age, overweight, male
OWC5MAIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
OWC5MAIN.definition: Prevalence of overweight children is the percentage of children under age 5 whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations above the median for the international reference population of the corresponding age as established by the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.

MALWFEIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, weight for age, underweight, female
MALWFEIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition

The data are based on the WHO's new child growth standards released in 2006.

MALWMAIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, weight for age, underweight, male

WASTFEIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, weight for height, wasting, female
WASTFEIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
WASTFEIN.definition: Wasting prevalence is the proportion of children under five whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59.

WASTMAIN.name: Malnutrition prevalence, weight for height, wasting, male
WASTMAIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; Data from WHO, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition
WASTMAIN.definition: Wasting prevalence is the proportion of children under five whose weight for height is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59.

CONTFEHQ.definition: Current use of contraception among currently married women, any method by household wealth index

CONTFEPE.name: Contraceptive prevalence, female, primary education

CONTFESE.name: Contraceptive prevalence, female, secondary or higher

CONPFEIN.name: Contraceptive prevalence, female
CONPFEIN.definition: Contraceptive prevalence is the percentage of women married or in-union aged 15 to 49 who are currently using, or whose sexual partner is using, at least one method of contraception, regardless of the method used.

TOFERTHQ.name: Fertility rate, female, highest income quintile
TOFERTHQ.definition: Total fertility rate represents the number of children that would be born to a woman if she were to live to the end of her childbearing years and bear children in accordance with current age-specific fertility rates, by household wealth index

DETOFEIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
DETOFEIN.definition: The mean number of deaths per 100,000 attributable to cause of disease or death

DETOMAIN.definition: The mean number of deaths per 100,000 attributable to cause of disease or death

DELCFEIN.definition: The mean number of deaths per 100,000 attributable to cause of disease or death

DELCMAIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)

DETBFEIN.definition: The mean number of deaths per 100,000 attributable to cause of disease or death

DETBMAIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
DETBMAIN.definition: The mean number of deaths per 100,000 attributable to cause of disease or death

AVDTFEIN.name: Mean age of death, female
AVDTFEIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
AVDTFEIN.definition: Average age of death overall for a population

AVDTMAIN.name: Mean age of death, male
AVDTMAIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
AVDTMAIN.definition: Average age of death overall for a population

ALCHFEIN.name: Risk factor, alcohol use, female
ALCHFEIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
ALCHFEIN.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

ALCHMAIN.name: Risk factor, alcohol use, male
ALCHMAIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
ALCHMAIN.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

DRUGFEIN.name: Risk factor, drug use, female
DRUGFEIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
DRUGFEIN.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

DRUGMAIN.name: Risk factor, drug use, male
DRUGMAIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
DRUGMAIN.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

PHIAFEDR.name: Risk factor, Physical inactivity, female
PHIAFEDR.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
PHIAFEDR.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

PHIAMADR.name: Risk factor, Physical inactivity, male
PHIAMADR.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
PHIAMADR.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

SMOKFEIN.name: Risk factor, tobacco use, female
SMOKFEIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
SMOKFEIN.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

SMOKMAIN.name: Risk factor, tobacco use, male
SMOKMAIN.source: Global Burden of Disease by Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (GBD by IHME)
SMOKMAIN.definition: The mean Disability Adjusted Life Years (DALY) rate per 100,000 attributable to risk factor/cause of disease or death

U5MRFEIN.name: Under 5 mortality rate, female
U5MRFEIN.source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (IGME)
U5MRFEIN.definition: Probability of dying between birth and exactly five years of age expressed per 1,000 live births

U5MRMAIN.name: Under 5 mortality rate, male
U5MRMAIN.source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (IGME)
U5MRMAIN.definition: Probability of dying between birth and exactly five years of age expressed per 1,000 live births

U5MORATO.name: Under 5 mortality ratio, total
U5MORATO.definition: Under-five mortality rate is the probability per 1,000 that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.

LE60FEIN.name: Life expectancy at 60 years, female
LE60FEIN.definition: The average number of remaining years of life expected by a hypothetical cohort of males or females alive at age 60 who would be subject during the remaining of their lives to the age- and sex-specific mortality rates of a given period. It is expressed as years.

LE60MAIN.name: Life expectancy at 60 years, male
LE60MAIN.definition: The average number of remaining years of life expected by a hypothetical cohort of males or females alive at age 60 who would be subject during the remaining of their lives to the age- and sex-specific mortality rates of a given period. It is expressed as years.

LE60TOIN.name: Life expectancy at 60 years, total
LE60TOIN.definition: The average number of remaining years of life expected by a hypothetical cohort of males or females alive at age 60 who would be subject during the remaining of their lives to the age- and sex-specific mortality rates of a given period. It is expressed as years.

LE00FEIN.name: Life expectancy at birth, female
LE00FEIN.definition: Indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.

LE00MAIN.name: Life expectancy at birth, male
LE00MAIN.definition: Indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.

LE00TOIN.name: Life expectancy at birth, total
LE00TOIN.definition: Indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.

ANTENAT4.name: Antenatal care coverage 4+, female
ANTENAT4.definition: The percentage of women aged 15-49 with a live birth in a given time period that received antenatal care four or more times as a percentage of women age 15-49 years with a live birth in a given time period. Available survey data on this indicator usually do not specify the type of the provider, therefore, in general, receipt of care by ANY provider is measured.

ANTENAT1.name: Antenatal care coverage 1+, female
ANTENAT1.definition: The percentage of women attended at least once during pregnancy by skilled health personnel for reasons related to pregnancy.

IBCGFEIN.name: BCG immunization, female
IBCGFEIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received one dose of Bacille Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine in a given year.

IBCGMAIN.name: BCG immunization, male
IBCGMAIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received one dose of Bacille Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine in a given year.

IDTPFEIN.name: DTP3 immunization, female
IDTPFEIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of the combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) vaccine in a given year.

IDTPMAIN.name: DTP3 immunization, male
IDTPMAIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of the combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) vaccine in a given year.

IFULFEIN.name: Full immunization, female
IFULFEIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received one dose of Bacille Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine, three doses of polio vaccine, three doses of the combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) vaccine, and one dose of measles vaccine.

IFULMAIN.name: Full immunization, male
IFULMAIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received one dose of Bacille Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine, three doses of polio vaccine, three doses of the combined diphtheria, tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) vaccine, and one dose of measles vaccine.

IMCVFEIN.name: MCV immunization, female
IMCVFEIN.definition: The percentage of children aged 12-23 months who have received at least one dose of measles-containing vaccine in a given year.

IMCVMAIN.name: MCV immunization, male
IMCVMAIN.definition: The percentage of children aged 12-23 months who have received at least one dose of measles-containing vaccine in a given year.

IPOLFEIN.name: Pol3 immunization, female
IPOLFEIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of polio vaccine in a given year.

IPOLMAIN.name: Pol3 immunization, male
IPOLMAIN.definition: The percentage of one-year-olds who have received three doses of polio vaccine in a given year.

BIRTSTAF.name: Births attended by skilled staff, female
BIRTSTAF.definition: The percentage of deliveries attended by personnel trained to give the necessary supervision, care, and advice to women during pregnancy, labor, and the postpartum period; to conduct deliveries on their own; and to care for newborns.

NURSMIDW.name: Nurses and midwives, per 1,000 people, total
NURSMIDW.definition: Include professional nurses, professional midwives, auxiliary nurses, auxiliary midwives, enrolled nurses, enrolled midwives and other associated personnel, such as dental nurses and primary care nurses.

BEDSDENS.name: Hospital beds (per 10 000 population)
BEDSDENS.definition: The number of inpatient beds available relative to the total population for the same geographical area.

MATMORTA.name: Maternal mortality ratio, female
MATMORTA.definition: The annual number of female deaths from any cause related to or aggravated by pregnancy or its management (excluding accidental or incidental causes) during pregnancy and childbirth or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the duration and site of the pregnancy, per 100,000 live births, for a specified year.

OPEXPHEA.name: Out-of-pocket expenditure as a % of private expenditure on health
OPEXPHEA.definition: any direct outlay by households, including gratuities and in-kind payments, to health practitioners and suppliers of pharmaceuticals, therapeutic appliances, and other goods and services whose primary intent is to contribute to the restoration or enhancement of the health status of individuals or population groups.

PREXPHEA.name: Private expenditure on health as a % of total expenditure on health
PREXPHEA.definition: Sum of expenditures on health by: prepaid plans, firms' expenditure on health, household out-of-pocket spending, and NGOs

PHYSDENS.name: Physicians density (per 1000 population)
PHYSDENS.definition: number of medical doctors (physicians), including generalist and specialist medical practitioners, per 1,000 of the population

TEENFEMO.name: % women ages 15-19 who have children or are pregnant
TEENFEMO.source: Compiled by World Bank; Source Demographic and Health Surveys by ICF International.
TEENFEMO.definition: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant.

TEPREGHQ.name: % women ages 15-19 who have children or are pregnant, highest income quintile
TEPREGHQ.definition: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant, by household wealth index

TEPREGLQ.name: % women ages 15-19 who have children or are pregnant, lowest income quintile
TEPREGLQ.definition: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant, by household wealth index

TEPREGNE.name: % women ages 15-19 who have children or are pregnant, no education
TEPREGNE.definition: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant, by highest educational level of respondent

TEPREGPE.name: % women ages 15-19 who have children or are pregnant, primary education
TEPREGPE.definition: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant, by highest educational level of respondent

TEPREGSE.name: % women ages 15-19 who have children or are pregnant, secondary education or higher
TEPREGSE.secondary: secondary education or higher, women ages 15-19, %
TEPREGSE.definition: Teenage mothers are the percentage of women ages 15-19 who already have children or are currently pregnant, by highest educational level of respondent

FEMAGEHQ.name: Median age at first marriage, female, highest income quintile
FEMAGEHQ.definition: The median age at first marriage is the median age of women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year (ages 25-49), by household wealth index

FEMAGELQ.name: Median age at first marriage, female, lowest income quintile
FEMAGELQ.definition: The median age at first marriage is the median age of women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year (ages 25-49), by household wealth index

FEMAGENE.name: Median age at first marriage, female, no education
FEMAGENE.definition: The median age at first marriage is the median age of women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year (ages 25-49), by highest educational level of respondent

FEMAGEPE.name: Median age at first marriage, female, primary education
FEMAGEPE.definition: The median age at first marriage is the median age of women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year (ages 25-49), by highest educational level of respondent

FEMAGESE.name: Median age at first marriage, female, secondary or higher
FEMAGESE.definition: The median age at first marriage is the median age of women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year (ages 25-49), by highest educational level of respondent

NOBFISSB.name: Number of obstetric fistula surgeries
NOBFISSB.source: Global Fistula Map, DirectRelief, Fistula Foundation, UNFPA

FGMCHIQU.name: FGMC prevalence among girls (%), highest income quintile
FGMCHIQU.definition: Proportion of women aged 15-49 years that report undergoing an extreme form of female genital mutilation/cutting (such as infibulation), by household wealth index

FGMCLOQU.name: FGMC prevalence among girls (%), lowest income quintile
FGMCLOQU.definition: Proportion of women aged 15-49 years that report undergoing an extreme form of female genital mutilation/cutting (such as infibulation), by household wealth index

PFGMCWGP.name: FGM/C prevalence among girls and women (%)
PFGMCWGP.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMCWGP.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls affected.

PFGMCWGF.name: FGM/C prevalence among girls and women, by current age 15-19 (%)
PFGMCWGF.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMCWGF.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 15-19.

PFGMCGPP.name: FGMC prevalence among girls (%)
PFGMCGPP.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMCGPP.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of girls affected.

PFGMCWTF.name: FGMC prevalence among girls and women by current age 20-24 (%)
PFGMCWTF.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMCWTF.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 20-24.

PFGMWGFN.name: FGMC prevalence among girls and women by current age 25-29 (%)
PFGMWGFN.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMWGFN.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 25-29.

PFGMWGTF.name: FGMC prevalence among girls and women by current age 30-34 (%)
PFGMWGTF.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMWGTF.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 30-34.

PFGMTFTN.name: FGMC prevalence among girls and women by current age 35-39 (%)
PFGMTFTN.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMTFTN.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 35-39.

PFGMFTFF.name: FGMC prevalence among girls and women by current age 40-44 (%)
PFGMFTFF.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMFTFF.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 40-44.

PFGMFFFN.name: FGMC prevalence among girls and women by current age 45-49 (%)
PFGMFFFN.source: UNICEF, Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting: A statistical overview and exploration of the dynamics of change, July 2013
PFGMFFFN.definition: Most types of FGM/C involve the cutting and removal of portions of the female genitalia. % of women and girls who had FGM/C by current age 45-49.

PCUFWBRF.name: % of female children under five with birth registration
PCUFWBRF.source: UNICEF Global Databases: Child Protection: Birth Registration
PCUFWBRF.definition: % of female children under five with birth registration

PCUFWBRM.name: % of male children under five with birth registration
PCUFWBRM.source: UNICEF Global Databases: Child Protection: Birth Registration
PCUFWBRM.definition: % of male children under five with birth registration

PEWAMUBA.name: % of women aged 20-24 who were married or in a union before age 18, female
PEWAMUBA.source: UNICEF Global Databases: Child Protection: Child Marriage
PEWAMUBA.definition: % of women aged 20-24 who were married or in a union before age 18

MAFBFWFR.name: Mean age at first birth
MAFBFWFR.definition: The mean age at first birth is the mean age of mothers at the birth of their first child if women were subject throughout their lives to the age-specific fertility rates of first order births in a given year.

MAFMFWFR.name: Mean age at first marriage, female
MAFMFWFR.definition: The mean age at first marriage is the mean age of men or women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year.

MAFMMWFR.name: Mean age at first marriage, male
MAFMMWFR.definition: The mean age at first marriage is the mean age of men or women at first marriage if subject throughout their lives to the age-specific marriage rates of first marriages only in a given year.

ADFERRAT.name: Adolescent fertility rate (births per 1,000 women, ages 15-19), female
ADFERRAT.definition: The adolescent birth rate measures the annual number of births to women 15 to 19 years of age per 1,000 women in that age group. It represents the risk of childbearing among adolescent women 15 to 19 years of age. It is also referred to as the age-specific fertility rate for women aged 15-19.

FMMWEYEE.name: Excess Female Deaths in the World, Girls at birth
FMMWEYEE.definition: Excess Female Deaths in the World, By Age and Region, 1990 and 2008 (thousands), Girls at birth

BLIXLSRF.name: BLI Life satisfaction, female
BLIXLSRF.definition: The indicator considers people's evaluation of their life as a whole. It is a weighted-sum of different response categories based on people's rates of their current life relative to the best and worst possible lives for them on a scale from 0 to 10, using the Cantril Ladder (known also as the "Self-Anchoring Striving Scale").

BLIXLSRM.name: BLI Life satisfaction, male
BLIXLSRM.definition: The indicator considers people's evaluation of their life as a whole. It is a weighted-sum of different response categories based on people's rates of their current life relative to the best and worst possible lives for them on a scale from 0 to 10, using the Cantril Ladder (known also as the "Self-Anchoring Striving Scale").

BLIXQSNF.name: BLI Quality of support network, female
BLIXQSNF.definition: A measure of perceived social network support. The indicator is based on the question: “If you were in trouble, do you have relatives or friends you can count on to help you whenever you need them, or not?” and it considers the respondents who respond positively.

BLIXQSNM.name: BLI Quality of support network, male
BLIXQSNM.definition: A measure of perceived social network support. The indicator is based on the question: “If you were in trouble, do you have relatives or friends you can count on to help you whenever you need them, or not?” and it considers the respondents who respond positively.

ERPBNWBL.name: Are employers required to provide break time for nursing mothers?
ERPBNWBL.source: World Bank, Women Business and the Law
ERPBNWBL.definition: Are employers required to provide break time for nursing mothers?

LPPDPWBL.name: Are there laws penalizing or preventing the dismissal of pregnant women?
LPPDPWBL.source: World Bank, Women Business and the Law
LPPDPWBL.definition: Are there laws penalizing or preventing the dismissal of pregnant women?

NERAPRFE.name: Adjusted net enrollment ratio in primary school, female
NERAPRFE.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
NERAPRFE.definition: Adjusted net enrolment rate in primary education can be calculated as the number of children of official primary school age who are enrolled either in primary or secondary education expressed as a percentage of the total population of children of official primary school age.

NERAPRMA.name: Adjusted net enrollment ratio in primary school, male
NERAPRMA.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
NERAPRMA.definition: Adjusted net enrolment rate in primary education can be calculated as the number of children of official primary school age who are enrolled either in primary or secondary education expressed as a percentage of the total population of children of official primary school age.

NERASEFE.name: Net enrollment ratio in secondary school, female
NERASEFE.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
NERASEFE.definition: The number of children enrolled in secondary school who belong to the age group that officially corresponds to secondary schooling, divided by the total population of the same age group.

NERASEMA.name: Net enrollment ratio in secondary school, male
NERASEMA.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
NERASEMA.definition: The number of children enrolled in secondary school who belong to the age group that officially corresponds to secondary schooling, divided by the total population of the same age group.

NERAPPFE.name: Net enrollment ratio in pre-primary school, female
NERAPPFE.source: UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics
NERAPPFE.definition: The number of children enrolled in pre-primary school who belong to the age group that officially corresponds to pre-primary schooling, divided by the total population of the same age group.

NERAPPMA.name: Net enrollment ratio in pre-primary school, male
NERAPPMA.source: UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics
NERAPPMA.definition: The number of children enrolled in pre-primary school who belong to the age group that officially corresponds to pre-primary schooling, divided by the total population of the same age group.

NERAPRGP.name: Adjusted net enrollment ratio in primary school, GPI
NERAPRGP.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
NERAPRGP.definition: Adjusted net enrolment rate in primary education can be calculated as the number of children of official primary school age who are enrolled either in primary or secondary education expressed as a percentage of the total population of children of official primary school age.

NERASEGP.name: Net enrollment ratio in secondary school, GPI
NERASEGP.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
NERASEGP.definition: The number of children enrolled in secondary school who belong to the age group that officially corresponds to secondary schooling, divided by the total population of the same age group.

NERAPPGP.name: Net enrollment ratio in pre-primary school, GPI
NERAPPGP.source: UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics
NERAPPGP.definition: The number of children enrolled in pre-primary school who belong to the age group that officially corresponds to pre-primary schooling, divided by the total population of the same age group.

GERATEFE.name: Gross enrollment ratio for tertiary school, female
GERATEFE.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
GERATEFE.definition: The number of children enrolled in tertiary school, regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

GERATEMA.name: Gross enrollment ratio for tertiary school, male
GERATEMA.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
GERATEMA.definition: The number of children enrolled in tertiary school, regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

ENRTFEPR.name: Gross enrollment ratio in primary school, female
ENRTFEPR.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
ENRTFEPR.definition: The number of children enrolled in a level (primary or secondary), regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

ENRTMAPR.name: Gross enrollment ratio in primary school, male
ENRTMAPR.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
ENRTMAPR.definition: The number of children enrolled in a level (primary or secondary), regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

ENRTTOPR.name: Gross enrollment ratio in primary school, total
ENRTTOPR.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
ENRTTOPR.definition: The number of children enrolled in a level (primary or secondary), regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

GERSFEIN.name: Gross enrollment ratio in secondary school, female
GERSFEIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
GERSFEIN.definition: The number of children enrolled in a level (primary or secondary), regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

GERSMAIN.name: Gross enrollment ratio in secondary school, male
GERSMAIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
GERSMAIN.definition: The number of children enrolled in a level (primary or secondary), regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

GERSTOIN.name: Gross enrollment ratio in secondary school, total
GERSTOIN.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
GERSTOIN.definition: The number of children enrolled in a level (primary or secondary), regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

GERATEGP.name: Gross enrollment ratio for tertiary school, GPI
GERATEGP.source: Compiled by World Bank; source: UNESCO
GERATEGP.definition: The number of children enrolled in tertiary school, regardless of age, divided by the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the same level.

BLIXSRSF.name: BLI Student skills, female
BLIXSRSF.definition: Students’ average score in reading, mathematics and science as assessed by the OECD’s Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA)

BLIXSRSM.name: BLI Student skills, male
BLIXSRSM.definition: Students’ average score in reading, mathematics and science as assessed by the OECD’s Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA)

BLIXYIEF.name: BLI Years in education, female
BLIXYIEF.definition: This indicator is the average duration of education in which a 5 year old child can expect to enrol during his/her lifetime until the age of 39. It is calculated under the current enrolment conditions by adding the net enrolment rates for each single year of age from the age of five onwards .

BLIXYIEM.name: BLI Years in education, male
BLIXYIEM.definition: This indicator is the average duration of education in which a 5 year old child can expect to enrol during his/her lifetime until the age of 39. It is calculated under the current enrolment conditions by adding the net enrolment rates for each single year of age from the age of five onwards .

PIFEDILA.name: PISA disadvantaged low-achievers, female
PIFEDILA.source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
PIFEDILA.definition: A student is classified as disadvantaged low-achiever if he or she is in the bottom quarter of the PISA index of economic, social and cultural status (ESCS) in the country/economy of assessment and performs in the bottom quarter of students from all countries/countries, after accounting for socio-economic status.

PIMADILA.name: PISA disadvantaged low-achievers, male
PIMADILA.source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

PIFERESI.source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

LCFWFEIN.name: Contributing family workers, Female
LCFWFEIN.source: International Labour Organization (ILO) Key Indicators of the Labour Market (KILM)

LCFWMAIN.source: International Labour Organization (ILO) Key Indicators of the Labour Market (KILM)

SCFWFEIN.source: International Labour Organization (ILO) Key Indicators of the Labour Market (KILM)

SOFEFEIN.source: International Labour Organization (ILO) Key Indicators of the Labour Market (KILM)

SOFEMAIN.source: International Labour Organization (ILO) Key Indicators of the Labour Market (KILM)
